content:
Change your authentication type in account settings for both the incoming account and the outgoing server(SMTP) to OAuth. That is all really.

However you may need to change the server names to the office365 ones and if you do need to make that change, restart Thunderbird and then change the authentication type.

content:
Thanks for the suggestion Matt. I checked and the prefs.js files were identical. Also checked profile.ini and installs.ini and several other Thunderbird files and they all seemed to be in order. I did check AV logs and did not see anything about any actions taken against any files yesterday much less any changes to Thunderbird or my profiles folder.

After several hours of trying to remove, reinstall, copy folders from my spare PC (which has the same v115 version of Thunderbird on it) to the main PC, etc., I gave up and restored my last Macrium Reflect image from Sunday (lucky I created a full only 4 days earlier) and that seemed to fire Thunderbird right up pointing to my profile! So the profile was definitely good.

I don't think it was AV. I think it was a failed Thunderbird update to the latest version. This new v128 didn't like my v115 profile. So I set Thunderbird to not update anymore (registry hack.)

I'll move on now and see how it goes.

content:
Lets go way back here. I have used compact regularly for decades now without issue. Compact has over the years had some bugs, but they have been few and far between really as regards to data-loss. User ignorance and assumption have seen a lot of apparent data-loss attributed to compact and this is yet another example. An imap account is synchronized, even when the server account is closed.

So we are looking for deleted mail post compact. I do not hold much hope at all because you are looking for deleted mail post the process that removes deleted mail from the storage folder. Go to the account settings in Thunderbird. on the first screen of server settings for the account it shows the local directory used by that account. Then once you have the correct folder open the inbox file (no extension) in a text editor. Does it contain anything?

As an aside, unless you have multiple account on zoho it may be worth looking in all of them as you used imap and may have reinstalled the account over the years and the residual mail may still be in those folders if the account was removed from Thunderbird.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Blue means you have never seen that email in a list before, it is new and unseen. Once you see it, you have seen it and it becomes an unread mail only.

Is the strato account sending on smtp.strato.de, 465, SSL/TLS, normal password, strato email address, while the gmx account sends on mail.gmx.net, 587, STARTTLS, normal password, gmx email address? Maybe the strato account is trying to send on the gmx smtp.

content: Hi, I checked through my list of smtp server settings (I run several email accounts with TB). The solution appears to be that the entry for strato.de appears twice, once as a normal one and once as a "(standard)" one. I have no idea why this is so, but the non-standard one used STARTTLS instead of SSL/ TLS like all others. After I changed that one to SSL / TLS as well it worked again. Maybe this helps others as well. Best

content:
Check that your gmail accounts also use OAuth2 authentication for the outgoing smtp, and that there are 2 gmail smtp servers, one for each account, with the same settings except for User Name.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1438310

Check that the outlook accounts use outlook.office365.com, 993 (IMAP) or 995 (POP), SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address for incoming, and smtp.office365.com, 587, STARTTLS, OAuth2, email address. As with gmail, there must be 2 smtp servers.

Both gmail and outlook automatically copy sent messages to Sent Mail (gmail IMAP) and Sent (outlook), so uncheck 'Place a copy in' in the Copies & Folders section of Account Settings.

content:
Bonjour, Okay, this may sound strange, but here is the real way to set fonts on Thunderbird. And I attached examples of my own setting of Calibri 14 as my default. Here goes: 

- in Tools>settings>general, set your default font.  - then click the advanced button. Notice the drop-down menu at top. It probably says 'latin' or 'other writing systems' - this is IMPORTANT:  - select 'latin from that menu, set your desired font and font size settings, click OK,  - select 'otherwritingsystems' from the drop-down menu and set the IDENTICAL settings to what you did for Latin, and then click OK. In attached screenshots you will see my latin and otherwritingsystem match.  Notice I also set monospace font. - and, if you have account set to compose HTML, then set that in tools>settings>composition to variable-width and medium font. (You would only change the HTML font setting if your intent is for recipient to receive your preferred font - not my personal recommendation.) - Set Sending Format to 'automatic'

With these settings, your compose window and your sent folders will match. And if you don't write HTML (e.g., bold, italic, color), none will be sent . If you do these settings once, your font will always be consistent. This does not protect you from someone sending you a message in some god-awful font with 30 pt size, but this does provide consistency.

TIP: As a reminder, these are points, not pixels, so you may not want to use my example of 14. A user I assisted yesterday found that 20 was preferable. Change everything in this post and you will have consistent writing. The nice feature that these settings offer is that, although you mmay do a setting for a large or small font, the font that your recipients get unchanged and defaults to whatever their email client is set to. If you have problems, be sure to post screenshots of the ones I present below.
creator: davidsk

content:
I am sorry, but that message is from your SMTP server owner. I have no idea who that is because you did not mention your mail provider.

The IP address mentioned in the error is certainly in the USA per this web site. https://ipinfo.io/23.227.149.3 they indicate it is registered to a company called 24 shells. https://www.24shells.net/

You say you are using mail system, which appears to be an addon for Drupal. https://www.drupal.org/project/mailsystem Neither of which I have heard of before today. uniserver appears to be in Canada https://home.uniserve.com/support/, so I am guessing it is your ISP, but their web site appears to be more focused on web hosting, so I don't really know.

So my uneducated guess is you have woven a tangled web that also includes a VPN with has an endpoint in the USA and something in your mix of providers does not like it. Probably your ISP as they are Canadian and probably have no reason to offer outgoing mail to a country they do not offer ISP services in. But that is just a guess.

What is not a guess is they provide a link to enable logins. You posted that so click it an lo. I end up as this web site belonging clearly based on the URL to uniserve where they tell me

You are attempting to send email from an unfamiliar ip address so this page will confirm that it's really you and not a spammer trying to guess your password and/or steal your account to send spam or commit identity theft/fraud. IPAddress: 23.227.149.3

So I am guessing my VPN idea is the most probably reason you appear in the USA, but really I have no idea as such. Only you know what software you have installed of what circles it makes to get mail. I can only guess. But if you are trying to send mail you have a perfectly good way to authorise mail from that IP address. But I have never heard of it. That is something you have to resolve, if the ip is actually the one you are using. I can not do that for you.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I saw you last topic and I see this one. But I have no idea what you are looking for. Thunderbird maintains a list of calendars that are configured in the application and that is all there is. There is not some file somewhere you can open and read like a word document.

When I open a calendar tab (alt+3) on the left under the month view calendar is a list of calendars configured. Do you not have that?

In opening this topic, I looked over your previous posts and closed a duplicate. But I think there are issues here that you only sort of understand based on your posts. I will try and make this an omnibus reply covering a lot of stuff that is not relevant to your calendar. So sorry in advance.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1408867

Standardise English usage so older generations understand instructions used / written by 20 to 30 year olds

I might not be 80, but the language used in most instances in support is based as simply as the person being communicated with can stand. That does not mean the next person will understand. My experience in these forums is that many of those can not even understand their problem in not the same as the one being discussed when they chime in, let alone the more technical parts of the discussion. I am forever being accused of being condescending because apparently treating folk like they have no clue is considered rude. Despite them having no clue. Who knew. Not me. But I was well over 50 before I ever heard of cotillion classes so I just get along and hope to offend a few as possible and ask them to respect my ideas of manners as they expect me to think of theirs.

But there is already a standard language on all Mozilla sites and communities. It is American English. Misspellings and all. It grates but you have to put up with it. At least I do.

and
Introduce a glossary so all non-nerd generations up to 80 year olds can understand what computer nerds are talking about or referring to on these websites etc!
There is a fairly good glossary of technical terms in Wikipedia. I use it all the time. Both to look things up and pass off links to explain things. https://www.wikipedia.org/

One of those I post regularly is this one as folk assume getting non delivery notifications in their mail for mail they did not send is "hacking" https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backscatter_(email)

Unfortunately we are never "educated" in the terms used online. I am forever looking things up that others use like I should know what they mean, and I have been bumping around computers and information technology since the 1980s. It is the life of those over 15 I think, not just those over 80.
creator: MattAuSupport
